name: Dvalin
desc: An Elemental Dragon and the Anemo Archon Barbatos's friend. After being poisoned by the Shadow Dragon's blood, he became known as Stormterror.

customize.text: Relationships

customize.name: Elemental Dragons
customize.desc: An ancient race, who ruled Teyvat long before human existence. Dragons belong to the Light Realm.

customize.text: Dvalin is an elemental dragon graced by Anemo.

customize.name: Barbatos
customize.desc: The Anemo Archon of Mondstadt.

customize.text: Anemo Archon Barbatos and Dvalin's friend.

customize.name: Durin
customize.desc: The Shadow Dragon and one of Rhinedottir's children.

customize.text: The Shadow Dragon, who fought with Dvalin and Barbatos during the Cataclysm.

customize.name: Four Winds
customize.desc: The four guardians of Mondstadt, who were summoned a thousand years ago and answer to the Anemo Archon. The Four Winds include the Wolf of the North, the Falcon of the West, the Lion of the South, and the Dragon of the East.

customize.text: Defenders of Mondstadt, who were summoned by

customize.name: Vennessa
customize.desc: A former slave, the founder and the first Grand Master of the Knights of Favonius, and the Dandelion Knight.

customize.text: Related Books and Items

customize.name: Skyward Atlas
customize.desc: A cloud atlas symbolizing Dvalin and his former master, the Anemo Archon. It details the winds and clouds of the northern regions and contains the powers of the sky and wind.

customize.name: Skyward Pride
customize.desc: A claymore that symbolizes the pride of Dvalin soaring through the skies. When swung, it emits a deep hum as the full force of Dvalin's command of the sky and the wind is unleashed.

customize.name: Skyward Spine
customize.desc: A polearm that symbolizes Dvalin's firm resolve. The upright shaft of this weapon points towards the heavens, clad in the might of sky and wind.

customize.name: Skyward Blade
customize.desc: The sword of a knight that symbolizes the restored honor of Dvalin. The blessings of the Anemo Archon rest on the fuller of the blade, imbuing the sword with the powers of the sky and the wind.

customize.name: Skyward Harp
customize.desc: A greatbow that symbolizes Dvalin's affiliation with the Anemo Archon. The sound of the bow firing is music to the Anemo Archon's ears. It contains the power of the sky and wind within.

customize.name: Dvalin's Claw
customize.desc:
A claw from the Dragon of the East.
It once contained the shadow dragon Durin's vile poison, having torn through the latter's flesh in battle. Thanks to your purification and healing, it is no longer toxic.

customize.name: Dvalin's Sigh
customize.desc:
A bit of power taken from the whirlwinds evoked by the Dragon of the East.
Beautiful and transparent, both trade winds and tornadoes will work in his name. The winds move as his companion, his voice, and his freedom.
His enemies are the thousands who stand against the wind.

customize.name: Dvalin's Plume
customize.desc:
A feather from the tail of the Dragon of the East.
As a dragon's feather it has experienced more than a thousand years' worth of winds. One senses within it a yearning for freedom so strong that it could whip up a light breeze to rescue it from its current confines. Its former owner's recognition of you is what makes it content to stay in your hands.

customize.name: Crimson Crystal
customize.desc: A teardrop crystal in which gloomy red gleams flow. Seems to have been left by the dragon. Perhaps the person that was talking with the dragon knows more about it, but where did he go?

customize.name: Tainted Blood
customize.desc:
Substance acquired from defeating Dvalin.
A crystal imbued with the winds of antiquity as well as another occult power from within the great dragon's body.

The mighty dragon was once a captive of a cage of toxicity, woven of three poisons:
The foul blood he once ingested, the lies whispered from the Abyss, and the anguish of abandonment.
Through tears shed and songs sung, the unholy spikes that had grown on Dvalin's body were smashed to pieces, and the web that had ensnared him was torn away...
Perhaps these feats were achievable only by a free-spirited traveler from a far-away land.

customize.name: Holy Lyre der Himmel
customize.desc: A treasure that once belonged to Barbatos, the Anemo Archon, but its Anemo power has all dried up.

customize.text: Trailers and Story Teasers
Character Tales - "Venti: The Four Winds"

<color=#ffd780>October 15, 2020</color>
This tale began a thousand years ago, when Mondstadt's rulers fell from grace. The southern lion their crowns to the earth did throw, and the west wind arose and took their place.
The guardian of the north returned, and near to the wolven wood he drew. The Four Winds blew each in their turn, and united they built Mondstadt anew.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Fontaine Gameplay Trailer

<color=#ffd780>August 23, 2023</color>
We've faced all sorts of perils, but never lost the courage to keep exploring.
A brand-new region, an all-new experience.
Embark on a new journey in Genshin Impact with Fontaine's gameplay trailer.
<color=#ff9999>YouTube:</color>
Dvalin

In ancient times, when the gods in their prime walked among the people, the elemental dragon graced by Anemo was born in the high heavens in that age of wonders. Elemental dragons are rarely seen and have the powers to match the gods of old. The high dragon slowly descended and inspected everything with curious eyes. He landed in a village, but the terrified villagers threw rocks at him. The dragon could not understand why they cried out in fear. He landed in a cemetery and only heard the lament of grieving people. The dragon was perplexed as to the reason for their sorrowful murmurs. He landed in an orchard but was cursed by the furious farmers who lost their trees. The dragon couldn't figure out why they yelled in fury. The world was too complicated for a young dragon. The dragon was bewildered, yet he did not give up. One day, the dragon heard music pouring out from the Holy Lyre der Himmel. This was the name of the lyre belonging to the Anemo Archon. Enchanted by the poetry, the Wind Dragon landed beside the best singer under the skies. People panicked, for the mighty elemental dragons and the great archons that reigned over the earth had never seen eye to eye.
<color=#ffffffd9>"Behold his beauty and benignity!"</color> The Windborne Bard sang.
<color=#ffffffd9>"But we do not know him,"</color> the people replied.

A mysterious magic lies behind the music and poetry, which has the power to mesmerize both dragons and humans. The dragon decided to stay with the bard, for he, too, wished to be understood by all souls. He learned human speech and the Windborne Bard's singing techniques. That's how the friendship between the high dragon Dvalin and Anemo Archon Barbatos began. Barbatos rejoiced in making a new friend and entrusted the people of Mondstadt to Dvalin.
When Barbatos and the slave Vennessa overthrew the Aristocracy of Mondstadt and Vennessa founded the Knights of Favonius to rule the people, she also summoned the Four Winds to protect Mondstadt. Dvalin became the Dragon of the East, and the people of Mondstadt worshiped him and other protectors for generations.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.desc: An ancient race, who ruled Teyvat long before human existence. Dragons belong to the Light Realm.

customize.text: Stormterror

500 years ago, the Eclipse Dynasty of the Khaenri'ah Kingdom fell. An alchemist named Gold, corrupted by her own greed and ambition, created an army of shadowy monsters with their uncanny powers that filled all seven kingdoms of Teyvat. These were particularly difficult times for Mondstadt. The Lionfang Knight was without a suitable heir, and the Knights of Favonius had lost many of their brave men and women during the bitter wars. The black serpent-dragon Durin was one of the "children" of the alchemist Rhinedottir, who rose from the sea, casting his shadow over Mondstadt. The people of Mondstadt believed that he wanted to destroy all living things. The envy of the devilish dragon gave rise to evil that poisoned the land and the people who lived on it. In those terrible days, bloodthirsty monsters and desolation came to Mondstadt.

Awoken from his sylvan slumber by the cries of Durin's victims, the Anemo Archon came forth and summoned his faithful servant to his side. For life and for freedom, the Archon and the Wind Dragon rode the wind to face their foe. In a battle that ripped clouds from the skies, Dvalin spread his six blessed wings wide, severing the sky and tearing through Durin's iron scales with the force of a colossal blade. As the conflict plunged the world into darkness, the Wind Dragon struck out with his claws, like swords forged of wind, and they pierced deep into Durin's dark, corrupt flesh. The battle shook the heavens; even the sun quaked with fear. Finally, Dvalin tore out Durin's throat with his teeth, and the evil dragon fell from the sky.

With his god's blessing, the Wind Dragon seized victory and saved the people of Mondstadt. Durin's body fell into the ruins of the ancient kingdom of Sal Vindagnyr, which has since been called the Dragonspine. Dvalin himself inadvertently swallowed Durin's poisonous blood, and it slowly poisoned his body to the marrow of his bones. The dragon lost consciousness from unbearable pain, and no one knew where Dvalin fell.
<color=#ffffffd9>"Should you awaken, spread your wings, and live your life freely! A dragon is born to soar the skies, and mortals shall surely grasp your beauty."</color>

People used to believe that Dvalin would awaken whenever Mondstadt faced a new threat. But in these times of peace, the belief in the Four Winds has gradually eroded, and their temples lie all but completely deserted. In the century while Dvalin slept, his image faded from Mondstadt's memory.

Awakening from a hundred-year sleep from the poison corroding his body, Dvalin did not hear the singing of the lyre of his faithful friend. He believed that Barbatos had betrayed and abandoned him. Now the people he once protected have fled from him. Deceived by the Abyss, the Wind Dragon fell to evil, and Stormterror was born. He settled in the ruins of Old Mondstadt, where the tyrant Decarabian ruled more than two thousand years ago. This place became known as the Stormterror's Lair.

Centuries later, Anemo Archon awoke from his sleep to find his friend in rage and anguish. At that time, Dvalin was controlled by the Abyss mage, whispering to him about the betrayal of Barbatos and the people of Mondstadt. With the help of the Traveler, Barbatos was able to heal Dvalin and clear the poison from his mind. Barbatos granted the dragon the blessing of Anemo Archon, and the six-winged high dragon finally remembered his friend. He asked Anemo Archon why he did not order him to protect the people, to which Barbatos replied: <color=#ffffffd9>"Freedom, if demanded of you by an Archon. Is really no freedom at all."</color> Riding on the boundless winds, Dvalin took to the skies once again.
<color=#ffd780>Related Entries:</color>

customize.name: Khaenri'ahn cataclysm
customize.desc: A disaster that occurred 500 years ago. The Abyss was released into Teyvat and Khaenri'ah was destroyed.

customize.name: Durin
customize.desc: The Shadow Dragon and one of Rhinedottir's children.

customize.name: Stormterror
customize.desc:
One of The Four Winds of Mondstadt: Dvalin, the Dragon of the East.
With the passage of long years and amid boundless darkness, even the purest gem will become dulled by dust, and even the noble dragon might be corrupted and cankered by hatred.
But never forget that dust can be wiped away, and the power of doubt and poison can be shattered.

"Fly freely in the sky.
"Just like you did in those days when we met, when I walked upon this land and sang the songs of the wind,
"And you soared on high, looking down on the world from above.
"Today, the sky is no longer swept by wind and snow. The green grass grows all over the earth, and it is beautiful.
"If you too could walk the earth and listen to the songs of shepherds and the scattered sound of wind chimes in the distance, if you could have tasted wine as sweet as honey, you would understand.
"How wonderful it would have been if you were as I, witnessing your noble, beautiful form as you soared through the blue sky.
"Then you would know that this sky and this earth are both things worth fighting for."

customize.name: Decarabian
customize.desc: The God of Storms and the ruler of Old Mondstadt. He was overthrown as a result of an uprising raised by the people of Mondstadt, who could not withstand the tyranny.

customize.name: Cryo Abyss Mage
customize.desc:
Abyss creatures that call upon Cryo in battle.
Though they dabble with great power and can even create icicles by condensing and freezing water vapor in the atmosphere, their bodies are very vulnerable in and of themselves. Once their protective barrier has been broken, they are at your mercy.
